summary.body: Does anyone know why it is necessary to water Thomas More gardens twice a day for twenty minutes at a time?  From TM house to about a third of the way up the garden the ground is waterlogged and horrible to walk on.  There are permanet puddles at the end by the school and on the path outside my flat.  Indeed when the ducks are around they walk from the lake to sit in the puddles!  We know the garden is built on builders and bomb rubble and doesn't drain easily , so why spend four hours a week watering?  Surely three times would be sufficient or even rely on the weather, in the winter in particular.  It's not as though the garden has wonderful species in it, in fact it's positively overgrown by Lambert Jones Mews.
summary.subject: Waterlogged gardens

summary.body: Is the Barbican slowly becoming an island? Two Wood Street access point have been lost and I found hoarding blocking my way at the Andrew's end of the estate yesterday. I suppose it makes us more secure in some ways but it looks as though the estate is becoming cut off and the corporation must be making money out of giving rights of access away for office space?
